value.title: Implement and manage storage for Azure administrators
value.excerpt: Learn how to manage storage accounts, data in Azure Storage, and Azure File and Blob storage.

topItems.title: Create an Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Create an Azure Storage account with the correct options for your business needs.

images.title: Create an Azure Storage account

topItems.title: Choose the right disk storage for your virtual machine workload
topItems.excerpt: Azure provides a variety of disk storage options for virtual machine workloads. Identify the features of capabilities of each type to ensure your application performs optimally.

images.title: Choose the right disk storage for your virtual machine workload

topItems.title: Secure your Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Storage provides multilayered security to protect your data. Find out how to use access keys, to secure networks, and to use Advanced Threat Protection to proactively monitor your system.

images.title: Secure your Azure Storage account

topItems.title: Store and share files in your application with Azure Files
topItems.excerpt: Azure Files provides a cloud-based file share for storing and sharing files to applications. Whether it's an application hosted in Azure App Service, an Azure VM, or an on-premises app, Azure Files can store and share file access between one or more applications and systems in a secure and failure-resilient manner.

images.title: Store and share files in your application with Azure Files
Create an Azure Storage account

value.title: Secure your cloud data in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: This learning path helps you leverage the built-in Azure services for securing app data, ensuring that only authorized services and clients have access.

topItems.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Discuss the basic concepts for protecting your infrastructure and data when you work in the cloud. Understand what responsibilities are yours and what Azure takes care of for you.

images.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure

topItems.title: Top 5 security items to consider before pushing to production
topItems.excerpt: Secure your web applications on Azure and protect your apps against the most common and dangerous web application attacks.

images.title: Top 5 security items to consider before pushing to production

topItems.excerpt: Learn how to set up policies to classify, retain, and protect your cloud-based data.

images.title: Configure security policies to manage data

topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Storage provides multilayered security to protect your data. Find out how to use access keys, to secure networks, and to use Advanced Threat Protection to proactively monitor your system.

images.title: Secure your Azure Storage account

value.title: Control Azure spending and manage bills with Azure Cost Management and billing learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to monitor and control your Azure spending and optimize the use of Azure resources.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Cost optimization
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use the cost optimization pillar of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework to design a cloud-based architecture that is efficient, eliminates waste, and gives you full visibility into where your money is spent on cloud resources.

images.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Cost optimization

topItems.title: Predict costs and optimize spending for Azure
topItems.excerpt: Cost is one of the most important aspects of the cloud and can have a massive impact on your business. Azure has several tools available to help you get a better understanding of cloud spend and some best practices that you can leverage to help you save money.

images.title: Predict costs and optimize spending for Azure

topItems.title: Analyze costs and create budgets with Azure Cost Management
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use cost analysis to understand how your costs accrue each month. Use this understanding to create an Azure budget to monitor and alert on your costs.

images.title: Analyze costs and create budgets with Azure Cost Management

topItems.title: Save money with Azure Reserved Instances
topItems.excerpt: Save money by taking advantage of Azure reservations. Analyze and decide what to purchase and then learn how to make a purchase. Understand the benefits provided through compute purchases and optimize against any under use. Perform basic reporting on your reservations.

images.title: Save money with Azure Reserved Instances
Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Cost optimization

value.title: Control Azure spending and manage bills with Azure Cost Management + Billing
value.excerpt: Learn how to monitor and control your Azure spending and optimize the use of Azure resources.

Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Cost optimization

value.title: Create no-code predictive models with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Machine learning is at the core of artificial intelligence, and many modern applications and services depend on predictive machine learning models. Learn how to use Azure Machine Learning to create and publish models without writing code.

topItems.title: Use automated machine learning in Azure Machine Learning
topItems.excerpt: Training a machine learning model is an iterative process that requires time and compute resources. Automated machine learning can help make it easier.

topItems.title: Create a Regression Model with Azure Machine Learning designer
topItems.excerpt: Regression is a supervised machine learning technique used to predict numeric values. Learn how to create regression models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

topItems.title: Create a classification model with Azure Machine Learning designer
topItems.excerpt: Classification is a supervised machine learning technique used to predict categories or classes. Learn how to create classification models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

topItems.title: Create a Clustering Model with Azure Machine Learning designer
topItems.excerpt: Clustering is an unsupervised machine learning technique used to group similar entities based on their features. Learn how to create clustering models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

value.title: Deploy a website to Azure with Azure App Service learning path
value.excerpt: In this learning path, get acquainted with using Azure App Service to create and deploy your website without underlying servers, storage or network assets.

topItems.title: Prepare your development environment for Azure development
topItems.excerpt: Set up your local development environment with several popular IDEs.

images.title: Prepare your development environment for Azure development

topItems.title: Host a web application with Azure App service
topItems.excerpt: Azure App Service enables you to build and host web applications in the programming language of your choice without managing infrastructure. Learn how to create a website through the hosted web app platform in Azure App Service.

images.title: Host a web application with Azure App service

topItems.title: Publish a web app to Azure with Visual Studio
topItems.excerpt: Use the publishing features of Visual Studio 2017 to deploy and manage an ASP.NET Core web application hosted on Azure.

images.title: Publish a web app to Azure with Visual Studio

topItems.title: Stage a web app deployment for testing and rollback by using App Service deployment slots
topItems.excerpt: Use deployment slots to streamline deployment and roll back a web app in Azure App Service.

images.title: Stage a web app deployment for testing and rollback by using App Service deployment slots
Prepare your development environment for Azure development

value.excerpt: Web apps in Azure allow you to publish and manage your website easily without having to work with the underlying servers, storage, or network assets. Instead, you can focus on your website features and rely on the robust Azure platform to provide secure access to your site.

value.title: Introduce the foundation pillars of DevOps: Culture and Lean Product
value.excerpt: DevOps is the union of people, process, and products to enable continuous delivery of value to our end users. Discover the first two foundation pillars of DevOps: Culture and Lean Product.

images.title: Introduce the foundation pillars of DevOps: Culture and Lean Product

value.excerpt: Learn how to architect compute infrastructure and solutions to automate your business processes in Azure.

topItems.excerpt: Review the Azure compute services and explore how they can solve common business needs.

images.title: Core Cloud Services - Azure compute options

topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use the cross-platform Azure CLI to create, start, stop, and perform other management tasks related to virtual machines in Azure.

topItems.title: Choose a compute provisioning solution for your application
topItems.excerpt: Discover the services and tools available to automate the deployment and configuration of your Azure infrastructure.

images.title: Choose a compute provisioning solution for your application

topItems.excerpt: Learn how Resource Manager templates express your deployments as code, enabling you to deploy faster and more reliably.

value.title: Architect message brokering and serverless applications in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to create reliable messaging for your applications, and how to take advantage of serverless application services in Azure.

topItems.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions
topItems.excerpt: Azure Functions allow developers to host business logic that can be executed without managing or provisioning infrastructure.

images.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions

topItems.title: Route and process data automatically using Logic Apps
topItems.excerpt: Define a workflow using built-in triggers, actions, and conditional operators. Your workflow will run automatically when data is available, process the data in the cloud, record results in a database, and send email notifications.

images.title: Route and process data automatically using Logic Apps

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: When you have an application that consists of components running on different computers, servers, and mobile devices, reliable communications between those components can be difficult and unreliable. Azure provides several technologies that you can use to communicate more reliably, including Storage queues, Event Hubs, Event Grid, and Service Bus. This module shows you how to choose the best technology for your communication task.

images.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Implement the publish-subscribe pattern in the cloud using Azure Queue storage.

images.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage

value.title: AZ-104: Configure and manage virtual networks for Azure administrators
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure and manage Azure network capabilities like connectivity services, application protection, application delivery, and network monitoring services. This learning path helps prepare you for Exam AZ-104: Microsoft Azure Administrator.

topItems.title: Configure the network for your virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to configure networking in a secure way for your Azure virtual machines.

images.title: Configure the network for your virtual machines

topItems.title: Design an IP addressing schema for your Azure deployment
topItems.excerpt: A good Azure IP addressing schema provides flexibility, room for growth, and integration with on-premises networks. The schema ensures that communication works for deployed resources, minimizes public exposure of systems, and gives the organization flexibility in its network. If not properly designed, systems might not be able to communicate, and additional work will be required to remediate.

images.title: Design an IP addressing schema for your Azure deployment

topItems.title: Host your domain on Azure DNS
topItems.excerpt: Create a DNS zone for your domain name. Create DNS records to map the URL to an IP address. Test that the domain name resolves to your web server.

images.title: Host your domain on Azure DNS

topItems.title: Distribute your services across Azure virtual networks and integrate them by using virtual network peering
topItems.excerpt: Use virtual network peering to enable communication across virtual networks in a way that's secure and minimally complex.

images.title: Distribute your services across Azure virtual networks and integrate them by using virtual network peering
Configure the network for your virtual machines

value.title: AZ-400: Develop a security and compliance plan
value.excerpt:
Build strategies around security and compliance that enable you to authenticate and authorize your users, handle sensitive information, and enforce proper governance.
Take this learning path to help prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Secure your identities by using Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Secure internal resources, external resources, SaaS applications, and more by using Azure Active Directory. Learn about the features and capabilities of Azure AD.

images.title: Secure your identities by using Azure Active Directory

topItems.title: Create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Create users in Azure Active Directory. Understand different types of groups. Create a group and add members. Manage business-to-business guest accounts.

images.title: Create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory

topItems.title: Authenticate apps to Azure services by using service principals and managed identities for Azure resources
topItems.excerpt: Securely authenticate applications to Azure to manage and access Azure services. Service principals and managed identities for Azure resources give your app an Azure Active Directory identity.

images.title: Authenticate apps to Azure services by using service principals and managed identities for Azure resources

topItems.title: Configure and manage secrets in Azure Key Vault
topItems.excerpt: Storing and handling secrets, encryption keys, and certificates directly is risky, and every usage introduces the possibility of unintentional data exposure. Azure Key Vault provides a secure storage area for managing all your app secrets so you can properly encrypt your data in transit or while it's being stored.

images.title: Configure and manage secrets in Azure Key Vault
Secure your identities by using Azure Active Directory

value.title: AZ-400: Develop an instrumentation strategy
value.excerpt:
Learn how logging, telemetry, and monitoring give you full visibility into what's happening in your environment.
Take this learning path to help prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging
topItems.excerpt: Use application logs in Azure Web Apps to help debug web app code.

images.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging

topItems.title: Control and organize Azure resources with Azure Resource Manager
topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Resource Manager to organize resources, enforce standards, and protect critical assets from deletion.

images.title: Control and organize Azure resources with Azure Resource Manager

topItems.title: Introduction to App Center
topItems.excerpt: Characterize the types of services offered by App Center. Describe the use of App Center to build, distribute, test, and analyze usage of apps.

images.title: Introduction to App Center

topItems.title: Azure Spring Cloud workshop
topItems.excerpt: In this workshop, you'll go through tasks to deploy Spring Boot microservices to Azure Spring Cloud (ASC).

images.title: Azure Spring Cloud workshop

value.excerpt: Learn how using Azure Storage, Azure SQL Database, and Azure Cosmos DB - or a combination of them - for your business scenario is the best way to get the most performant solution.

images.title: Choose a data storage approach in Azure

value.title: Enabling digital transformation
value.excerpt: Digital transformation is a business innovation fueled by the explosion of the cloud, artificial intelligence (AI), and the internet of things (IoT).  and allows organizations with new ways to understand and transform their business.

images.title: Enabling digital transformation

value.title: Administer containers in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: With this learning path, you'll create and manage your Azure Container Instances, and see how they can be used to provide elastic scale for Kubernetes.

topItems.title: Introduction to Docker containers
topItems.excerpt: Describes the benefits of using Docker containers as a containerization platform. Discuss the infrastructure provided by the Docker platform.

images.title: Introduction to Docker containers

topItems.title: Build a containerized web application with Docker
topItems.excerpt: Package a web app so that it can be deployed as a Docker image and run from an Azure Container Instance.

images.title: Build a containerized web application with Docker

topItems.title: Build and store container images with Azure Container Registry
topItems.excerpt: Azure Container Registry is a managed Docker registry service based on the open-source Docker Registry 2.0. Container Registry is private, hosted in Azure, and allows you to build, store, and manage images for all types of container deployments. Learn how to build and store container images with Azure Container Registry.

images.title: Build and store container images with Azure Container Registry

topItems.title: Run Docker containers with Azure Container Instances
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to run containerized apps using Docker containers with Azure Container Instances (ACI).

images.title: Run Docker containers with Azure Container Instances

value.title: Administer containers in Azure
value.excerpt: Azure Container Instances are the quickest and easiest way to run containers in Azure. This learning path will teach you how to create and manage your containers, and how ACI can be used to provide elastic scale for Kubernetes.

topItems.excerpt: Describes the benefits of using Docker containers as a containerization platform. Discuss the infrastructure provided by the Docker platform.

value.excerpt: Learn how to migrate resources to Azure, how to provide site recovery for your applications in Azure and on-premises, and how to your applications are available through service interruptions and changes in load.

topItems.title: Design your migration to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Minimize the time and resources required to migrate your on-premises environment to Azure. Assess your current systems with Azure Migrate, and migrate them with Azure Site Recovery and Azure Database Migration Service.

images.title: Design your migration to Azure

topItems.title: Protect your on-premises infrastructure from disasters with Azure Site Recovery
topItems.excerpt: Provide disaster recovery for your on-premises infrastructure by managing and orchestrating replication, failover, and failback of VMware virtual machines, Hyper-V virtual machines, and physical servers with Azure Site Recovery.

images.title: Protect your on-premises infrastructure from disasters with Azure Site Recovery

topItems.title: Protect your Azure infrastructure with Azure Site Recovery
topItems.excerpt: Provide disaster recovery for your Azure infrastructure by managing and orchestrating replication, failover, and failback of Azure virtual machines with Azure Site Recovery.

topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Backup to help protect the data for on-premises servers, virtual machines, virtualized workloads, SQL Server, Azure Files, and more.

images.title: Run Docker containers with Azure Container Instances

topItems.title: Build and store container images with Azure Container Registry
topItems.excerpt: Azure Container Registry is a managed Docker registry service based on the open-source Docker Registry 2.0. Container Registry is private, hosted in Azure, and allows you to build, store, and manage images for all types of container deployments. Learn how to build and store container images with Azure Container Registry.

images.title: Build and store container images with Azure Container Registry

topItems.title: Host a web application with Azure App service
topItems.excerpt: Azure App Service enables you to build and host web applications in the programming language of your choice without managing infrastructure. Learn how to create a website through the hosted web app platform in Azure App Service.

images.title: Host a web application with Azure App service

value.title: Architect modern applications in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to build modern applications using PaaS services for applications, caching, containers and Kubernetes in Azure.

topItems.title: Build a containerized web application with Docker
topItems.excerpt: Package a web app so that it can be deployed as a Docker image and run from an Azure Container Instance.

value.title: Architect secure infrastructure in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: Learn about the tools and services available on Azure to ensure your resources are secure.

topItems.title: Resolve security threats with Azure Security Center
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you’ll use the alert capabilities of Azure Security Center to watch for and respond to threats.

images.title: Resolve security threats with Azure Security Center

topItems.title: Secure your Azure virtual machine disks
topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Disk Encryption (ADE) to encrypt OS and data disks on existing and new VMs.

images.title: Secure your Azure virtual machine disks

topItems.title: Manage secrets in your server apps with Azure Key Vault
topItems.excerpt: Your application requires service passwords, connection strings, and other secret configuration values to do its job. Storing and handling secret values is risky, and every usage introduces the possibility of leakage. Azure Key Vault, in combination with managed identities for Azure resources, enables your Azure web app to access secret configuration values easily and securely without needing to store any secrets in your source control or configuration.

images.title: Manage secrets in your server apps with Azure Key Vault

topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use RBAC to manage access to resources in Azure.
